In this article, I'm going to share my predictions for the US sports betting market. 

What lense should we put on it?

Let's do two time periods: 

* **2025**
* **2030**

I'm going to forecast the market share and trends for the US sports betting market. Think FanDuel vs DraftKings vs BetMGM vs Barstool etc.

Plus we're also going to discuss the influence of some tech heavy exchanges.

Have you heard of **Polymarket**, **Kalshi** or **Sporttrade** yet?

LFG.

- - -

## **2025: US Sports Betting Environment**

Firstly. We know the States are broke AF. 

Like me with two kids and a wife with taste.

Covid lockdowns and hurting small businesses, has helped **[Cuomo backflip in NY](https://www.si.com/gambling/2021/04/21/online-sports-betting-allowed-in-new-york)**. 

**[Florida are fasttracking their legalization and Arizona are nearly good to go](https://www.legalsportsreport.com/50949/sports-betting-news-april-26-2021/)**. With many more states to presumably follow.

And Canada are **[getting in on the action](https://www.cbc.ca/sports/the-buzzer-newsletter-canada-legalizing-sports-betting-1.6000435)** too.

So the billion dollar gold rush is years ahead of where most of it thought it would be.

That Chinese virus has helped Flutter (FanDuel / Sportsbet in Australia / Paddy Power / Betfair) more than you can possibly imagine.
